hero.freeDescription: Mastery over their body, their mind, their world. A path that belongs to them.
hero.curiousDescription: What Einstein called his only real talent. The drive to inquire, wonder, discover, create.
hero.capableDescription: The freedom to try. The permission to fail. The drive to grow. Becoming capable of anything.

whatWeAre.line2: Mud beneath their feet. Sky above their heads.
whatWeAre.line3: A thousand choices, made by them.
whatWeAre.conclusion: This is how children become extraordinary.

freePlay.title: Free Play
freePlay.subtitle: Builds creativity & problem-solving
freePlay.science: Children in autonomy-supportive environments show higher creativity, deeper learning, and stronger intrinsic motivation than those in reward-based settings.

animalCare.title: Animal Care
animalCare.subtitle: Develops empathy & responsibility
animalCare.science: Children who care for animals develop stronger empathy that transfers to humans. Having responsibility for another living being builds moral reasoning.

mudPlay.title: Mud Play
mudPlay.subtitle: Strengthens immunity & senses
mudPlay.science: Within one month, children playing in forest soil show improved immune responses. One gram of soil contains 10 billion microorganisms that train the immune system.

baking.title: Baking
baking.subtitle: Teaches math & sequencing
baking.science: Baking naturally teaches math concepts like measuring, fractions, and sequencing. Children develop patience, follow multi-step instructions, and experience the reward of creating something tangible.

yoga.title: Yoga, Meditation & Sound Healing
yoga.subtitle: Improves focus & self-regulation
yoga.science: Mindfulness practices in children improve attention, emotional regulation, and reduce anxiety. Even brief meditation sessions enhance focus and self-awareness.

storytelling.title: Storytelling
storytelling.subtitle: Boosts memory & vocabulary
storytelling.science: Stories connect content with emotion, storing memories in more brain locations. Children retain learning better and transfer it to real-life contexts.

gardening.title: Gardening
gardening.subtitle: Grows patience & science skills
gardening.science: A meta-analysis of 50 studies shows garden-based learning increases academic outcomes, particularly in math. Children also develop responsibility and teamwork.

phonics.title: Playful Phonics
phonics.subtitle: Foundations for reading
phonics.science: Play-based phonics instruction builds stronger foundations than drill-based methods. Children develop phonemic awareness naturally through songs, games, and storytelling.

art.title: Art
art.subtitle: Builds confidence & fine motor skills
art.science: Art activities develop fine motor skills, emotional expression, and creative thinking. Process-focused art builds confidence and self-expression without judgment.

camps.title: Holiday Camps
camps.description: Experience Bamboo Valley during school holidays. Our camps offer the same nature-immersed, child-led learning—perfect for families wanting to try our approach before enrolling, or simply give their children an extraordinary break.

community.title: A community, not just a school
community.description: Monthly gatherings. Seasonal celebrations. Parents who become friends. Teachers who become family. A village raising children together.

cta.title: Questions? Just ask.
cta.description: We love chatting with parents. No pressure, just honest answers.
